In the current study, the mouthwashes were examined in a static condition. However, more metal release could occur in the real life due to the fluidity of saliva in the mouth and removal of oxide layers by tooth brushing. Kerosuo et al
26 reported a great amount of release after using an oral functioning simulator apparatus to simulate the dynamic conditions of the mouth.In our study, the level of ion released from Ni‒Cr disks was within the safe limits recommended by the World Health Organization. The recommended maximum limit for Niis 200‒300 μg.
